q: political operatives say he must do if he hopes to be re-elected. "The jury is still out on which way the Bill Clinton is going to go," said Greg Mueller , a Republican political strategist. Will he continue to draw lines in the sand far to the left of the electorate or is he going to lurch to the middle the way Bill Clinton did to see if he can come back? The State of the Union is the kickoff of his re-election campaign. "For a Democratic Bill Clinton to win, you have to move to the center," said Mike Pence Martin, a Democratic operative from Missouri. "This country is not ready for a pure progressive.

For whatever reason, the administration never made public these facts about an active WMD production facility run by terrorists in Iraq, Rumsfeld wrote. He said he made his recommendation to President Bush at a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell previewed his presentation to the U.N. in two days.

Mitch Daniels has said he won't make a decision about running for president until after this year's legislative season ends in April. If( Mitch Daniels ) runs, I think it's hard for Mike Pence , because all the financial base in Indiana would likely go to Mitch Daniels , Charlie Black said. But Mike Pence also can't afford to wait to decide because he has a long way to go in building a fundraising network and a campaign team, and becoming better-known.

, Google's chief executive Eric Schmidt rejected the notion that Google was losing key people. "Our retention has been actually the same and our turnover has been exactly the same for seven years," he said. We're going to be hiring many thousands of people this year. Mr Eric Schmidt , speaking at the DLD media conference in Munich yesterday, said he expected to spend another 10 years at the company, after his surprise handover last week to co-founder Larry Page.

in Italy starting in 2012 as part of a venture with Chrysler. Under the deal with unions, workers will put in more hours, take shorter breaks and risk having pay withheld for persistent absenteeism. Integration with Chrysler may lead to new combinations, so it's crucial to stress the importance now of a prominent position for Italy, Labor Minister Maurizio Sacconi , who will attend the meeting and spoke with Sergio Marchionne last week, said in an interview. "The government wants to verify with Fiat's management the status of the Italian investment plan."
